meanings.definition: A word or phrase that means the same or nearly the same as another word or phrase.
meanings.sent1: In the thesaurus, you can find a synonyme for almost any word.
meanings.sent2: She used a synonyme for 'happy' by saying 'joyful'.
meanings.sent3: The teacher joked that 'big' was a synonyme for 'enormous'.
meanings.sent4: His smile was a synonyme for his happiness.
meanings.sent5: Finding a synonyme can make your writing more interesting.

meanings.definition: A word or phrase that can be substituted for another in a particular context.
meanings.sent1: When writing, it's helpful to have a synonyme ready in case you repeat a word.
meanings.sent2: The synonyme 'automobile' can be used instead of 'car'.
meanings.sent3: She decided to use the synonyme 'snack' instead of 'treat'.
meanings.sent4: His apology was a synonyme for regret.
meanings.sent5: Using a synonyme can add variety to your speech.
